IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY FOR EACH OF ITS MEMBERS BY PROVIDING PREMIER DEVELOPMENTAL, THERAPEUTIC, EDUCATIONAL AND VOCATIONAL SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND ADULTS OF ALL ABILITIES IN A COLLABORATIVE AND CREATIVE ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO STRENGTHEN OUR COMMUNITY FOR EACH OF ITS MEMBERS BY PROVIDING PREMIER DEVELOPMENTAL, THERAPEUTIC, EDUCATIONAL AND VOCATIONAL SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND ADULTS OF ALL ABILITIES IN A COLLABORATIVE AND CREATIVE ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES - HAS 27 24-HOUR FACILITIES HOUSING OVER 138 INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES; PROVIDES LESS THAN 24 HR SERVICE TO 56 PEOPLE LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CHILDREN'S SERVICES - OVER 1,100 INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES RECEIVED EARLY INTERVENTION AND OTHER OUTREACH AND GROUP SERVICES FOR PRESCHOOL CHILDREN INCLUDING DAY CARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: DAY/ EMPLOYMENT SERVICES - PROVIDES SERVICES TO MEET THE WORK NEEDS OF DISABLED ADULTS AND FACILITATE THEIR PARTICIPATION IN COMMUNITY-BASED EMPLOYMENT, ALONG WITH OPPORTUNITIES IN JOB PLACEMENT, SHELTERED WORKSHOP, SUPPORTED WORK, DAY HABILITATION, AND COMMUNITY SOCIAL EXPERIENCES. SERVED OVER 300 PEOPLE IN FY2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: FAMILY ADVOCACY & COMMUNITY EDUCATION - PROVIDES RESOURCES AND REFERRAL AND SERVICE NAVIGATION TO FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES OR OTHER AT-RISK ISSUES. ALSO PROVIDES INDIVIDUAL/COMMUNITY SUPPORTS, RESPITE CARE, AND ADULT FOSTER CARE SERVICES. OVER 3,000 FAMILIES RECEIVED SERVICES IN FY2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AGENCY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES AS A PUBLIC CHARITY UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE UNITED STATES INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT THE AGENCY OPERATES IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THEIR TAX-EXEMPT STATUS AT BOTH THE STATE AND FEDERAL LEVEL. THE AGENCY ANNUALLY FILES IRS FORM 990 - RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX, REPORTING VARIOUS INFORMATION THAT THE IRS USES TO MONITOR THE ACTIVITIES OF TAX-EXEMPT ENTITIES. THE AGENCY ALSO ANNUALLY FILES IRS FORM 990-T - EXEMPT ORGANIZATION'S BUSINESS INCOME TAX RETURN, FOR ALL OF ITS TAXABLE TRANSACTIONS. THESE TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, GENERALLY FOR A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED. THE AGENCY CURRENTLY HAS NO TAX EXAMINATIONS IN PROGRESS. FOR THE AGENCY'S TAX YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, THE AGENCY PAID NO INCOME TAXES RELATED TO ITS TAXABLE INCOME.
PARTICIPANTS IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN: ROBERT CANUEL - PRESIDENT: $124,879 WILLIAM PERKINS - CEO: $22,182 MEGAN SCHEFFER - COO: $23,890

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCE MORTGAGES AND BUILD NEW GROUP HOME.
ACQUISITION OF AN OFFICE BUILDING AND PARKING LOT.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED WORKERS' COMPENSATION INSURANCE FROM F.X. PERON INSURANCE AGENCY WHICH IS OWNED BY MR. BEDARD.
THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE PRINTING SERVICES OF MALLARD PRINTING COMPANY WHICH IS OWNED BY MR. MARQUES.
DENNIS READ IS THE ORGANIZATION'S BROKER FOR HEALTH AND DENTAL BENEFITS. HE RECEIVED COMMISSIONS FROM BLUE CROSS AND ALTUS DENTAL RELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES.
THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED GENERAL LIABILITY INSURANCE THROUGH RUA DUMONT AUDET INSURANCE AGENCY, INC., OF WHICH MR. RUA IS A PRINCIPAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE EXTERNAL AUDITORS AND REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. REVISIONS, CORRECTIONS, ETC. ARE MADE AS NECESSARY. ONCE ALL ARE SATISFIED WITH THE FORM, IT IS FINALIZED AND A COPY IS SENT TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS. A REVIEW OF HIGHLIGHTED ITEMS IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY AT A BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS PROVIDED TO ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THESE PEOPLE ARE ASKED TO REVIEW THE POLICY AND SIGN A STATEMENT INDICATING THAT THEY UNDERSTAND THE POLICY, HAVE REPORTED ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE PAST YEAR IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY AND WILL REPORT ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE COMING YEAR. ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE EVALUATED BY THE BOARD TO DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT ACTUALLY EXISTS. IN THOSE INSTANCES WHERE THE POTENTIAL TRANSACTION IS A CONFLICT THE BOARD EXAMINES THE TRANSACTION AND A VOTE IS TAKEN (WITH THOSE INVOLVED RECUSING THEMSELVES) AS TO WHETHER THE ORGANIZATION WILL ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY THE BOARD CONDUCTS A PERFORMANCE REVIEW AND EVALUATION OF THE CEO. THE REVIEW ALSO ESTABLISHES THE INDIVIDUAL'S COMPENSATION FOR THE FOLLOWING YEAR. THIS PROCESS INVOLVES THE EVALUATION OF THE INDIVIDUAL AND A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION OF COMPARABLE POSITIONS OBTAINED FROM THE FORM 990 OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. THE BOARD'S DELIBERATION AND DECISION IS NOTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS (ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BY-LAWS) ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAIL COPIES UPON REQUEST OR PROVIDE COPIES TO THOSE WHO COME TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. THE ORGANIZATION CHARGES FOR THE COPIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH IRS REGULATIONS.
